1/22/2026.name: Family Action Network presents: Parenting Anxiety: Breaking the Cycle of Worry and Raising Resilient Kids
1/22/2026.description:
Parenting is hard-especially for families navigating anxiety. Today's parents face an overwhelming volume of advice shaped by rigid cultural ideals of what "good" parenting looks like, particularly when it comes to managing children's fears and worries. How do you raise resilient children in an age of uncertainty? How do you parent effectively when you yourself are anxious? Much of the advice parents encounter, unfortunately, encourages responses that can increase the long-term risk of anxiety in children. In trying to protect kids from discomfort, well-intentioned parents may block experiences children need to build courage, confidence, and resilience.

In her new book Parenting Anxiety: Breaking the Cycle of Worry and Raising Resilient Kids, Meredith Elkins, Ph.D., a clinical psychologist and faculty member at Harvard Medical School, brings clarity to this increasingly urgent conversation. Drawing on her clinical work with children and families-and her own experience as a parent-Dr. Elkins helps parents rethink so-called "negative" emotions such as fear, sadness, and guilt, and understand how modern parenting pressures contribute to anxiety in both children and adults. She encourages families to clarify their values and adopt a "love and limits" approach-balancing compassion with healthy boundaries while resisting the urge to shield children from every discomfort.

















 LINKS 
 *  Event Page

2/3/2026.name: Odyssey Activity Peiod: Frosh/Soph Play Preview
2/3/2026.description:
Odyssey invites students to join Patriot Theatre Company for a preview of the Freshman-Sophomore Play, "Too Much Light Makes the Baby Go Blind," on Tuesday, February 3rd, during Activity Period.

Enjoy a selection of scenes from the longest-running play in Chicago! Students who complete the Sign Up Form will receive a hall pass in their 5Star app to attend the performance.

 üéüÔ∏è  Sign Up Form

2/5/2026.name: 2026 Frosh/Soph Play: Too Much Light Makes the Baby Go Blind
2/5/2026.description:
The year's Freshmen/Sophomore play is a high-energy, audience-involved experience. The company has prepared 30 short plays that they hope to perform in under 60 minutes. The audience chooses the order of the play by calling out numbers as a timer counts down the minutes. Having opened in 1988,  Too Much Light Makes the Baby Go Blind  is the longest-running show in Chicago history. Our 30 plays are from a collection written and chosen by the creator, Greg Allen.

The company chose the 30 plays in our production from a collection of 105 Neo-Futurist plays. Additionally, they participated in two days of workshops with a Neo-Futurist Ensemble Member to better understand and apply the Neo-Futurist tenets of presence and task.



 üéüÔ∏è   PURCHASE Tickets via GoFAN :  Feb. 5  |  Feb. 6  |  Feb. 7 
üìñ  DOWNLOAD: Event Program

2/9/2026.name: CCC Presents: Community College Week
2/9/2026.description:
Similar to college rep visits during the fall, interested students should  register in Naviance  (except for CLC) and connect with their teacher before the scheduled visit. 


 *  Monday, Feb. 9  * 4th, 5th, 6th & 8th period -  College of Lake County  (in-district community college with guaranteed admission with dozens of four-year colleges)
* no need to sign up, come during your lunch/free period


* Seniors -- we will help you apply (bring your SAT/ACT login, a non-D125 email access, and your Social Security number, if applicable)
 
*  Tuesday, Feb. 10  * 3th period -  Harper College  (Palatine - students receive in-district tuition rates by working within campus boundaies)
 
*  Wednesday, Feb. 11  * 6th period -  Oakton Community College  (two campuses -- Des Plaines & Niles)

2/25/2026.name: Winter Choir Concert
2/25/2026.description: Our Winter Choir Concert features all three of our amazing curricular choirs (Patriot Singers, Advanced Choir, Stevenson Singers), singing music from all over the world: Puerto Rico, Haiti, Greece, Japan and Venezuela. Our student performances will also highlight African American Spirituals and Gospel music for Black History Month.  Those who can't attend can stream the event via Vimeo .

3/4/2026.name: Winter Band Concert
3/4/2026.description: Stevenson High School bands will be performing a concert of global music from top band composers. We will also have a guest Tabla player for a piece by an Indian composer and host the Zion Benton Band on Thursday, March 5.  Those who cannot attend in person can stream the event via Vimeo .

3/6/2026.name: 2026 Winter Play: Puffs, or Seven Increasingly Eventful Years at a Certain School of Magic and Magic
3/6/2026.description:
Get ready for a night of big laughs, surprising heart, and a whole lot of magic ‚ú®



Puffs is a fast-paced, hilarious, and surprisingly touching comedy that tells the story of the other students at a certain famous wizard school-the ones who weren't chosen as heroes, but showed up anyway. Full of clever humor, theatrical magic, and moments that genuinely hit home, this show celebrates friendship, perseverance, and finding your place, even when you feel overlooked.

This production is a true ensemble event, with over 30 students onstage and another 30 students behind the scenes working together to create an epic theatrical experience. From inventive staging to quick-fire comedy, it's a celebration of teamwork, creativity, and student talent at every level.
The show runs approximately 2 hours and 15 minutes and includes mature and atmospheric language. It is appropriate for most audiences and perfect for families, students, and anyone who loves comedy with heart.

Whether you're a theatre fan, a fantasy lover, or just looking for a fun night out, Puffs promises laughs, surprises, and a whole lot of spirit. ü™Ñüé≠  

 PURCHASE TICKETS HERE .

 Puffs is not authorized, sanctioned, licensed or endorsed by J.K Rowling, Warner Bros. or any person or company associated with the Harry Potter books, films or play. 

 Content Warning: Mature Language and atmospherics and haze will be used.

4/21/2026.name: Freshmen Wellness Day
4/21/2026.description:
While all the sophomores are taking their Pre-ACTs, all freshmen will spend a fun-filled day with SHS staff to explore the theme of "Live in Community!" Through a variety of activities, freshmen will grow their skills to:
 * Build character and a sense of confidence while appreciating the similarities and differences of others.
* Listen to others and communicate in ways that build empathy and respect.
* Understand what it means to be an effective ally when people are treated with disrespect or injustice.
* Establish and maintain supportive relationships in ways that foster learning.
4/21/2026.location: Stevenson High School | Patriot Wellness Center

5/1/2026.name: Polish Community Night 2026
5/1/2026.description:
The   Stevenson Polish Club   organizes Polish Community Night each year to celebrate the Polish heritage of students here at Stevenson, celebrating our Polish Constitution Day, when Poland became the second country in the world after the United States to make a constitution. At this event, everyone from all backgrounds is welcome to come and dance to authentic music, delight in a variety of Polish foods and desserts, and enjoy fun activities like face painting, Polish trivia, games, and more!

Follow   @shspolishclub   on Instagram or read this   multilingual Google Doc     for more information!
5/1/2026.location: Stevenson High School | Room 5120/5128 (Patriot Wellness Center)
